entry.title: India‚Äôs Central Bank Chief: Cryptocurrencies Will Cause Next Financial Crisis if They‚Äôre Not Banned
entry.summary:
The governor of India‚Äôs central bank, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), has warned that the next financial crisis will come from cryptocurrencies, like bitcoin and ether. The central bank chief added that cryptocurrencies pose ‚Äúhuge inherent risks‚Äù to India‚Äôs macroeconomic and financial stability.
Indian Central Bank Warns About Crypto Causing the Next Financial Crisis
Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das warned about the danger of cryptocurrency Wednesday. The central banker cautioned:
Cryptocurrencies have ‚Ä¶ huge inherent risks for our macroeconomic and financial stability.
The RBI is primarily concerned about cryptocurrencies having no underlying value, Das clarified, emphasizing that crypto is ‚Äúspeculative‚Äù and should be banned.
Indian authorities refer to any‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Senator Introduces Bill to Regulate Payment Stablecoins
entry.summary:
A U.S. senator has introduced a bill to ‚Äúestablish the first federal regulatory framework for payment stablecoins.‚Äù The lawmaker explained: ‚ÄúThis bill will also ensure the Federal Reserve, which has displayed significant skepticism about stablecoins, won‚Äôt be in a position to stop this activity.‚Äù
Stablecoin TRUST Act of 2022
U.S. Senator Pat Toomey (R-PA), ranking member of the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, introduced the ‚ÄúStablecoin Transparency of Reserves and Uniform Safe Transactions Act of 2022‚Äù on Wednesday. The bill is also known as the ‚ÄúStablecoin TRUST Act of 2022.‚Äù
According to the lawmaker, the legislation would ‚Äúestablish the first federal regulatory framework for payment stablecoins and guide Congress towards a path for sensible regulation of c‚Ä¶

Bitcoin‚Äôs Trading Has Become ‚ÄúBoring‚Äù: Is This a Bad or Good Thing?
entry.summary: As the price of bitcoin continues on its sideways journey, it's helpful to consider this volatility compared to previous episodes. This is an opinion editorial by Francois Moreau, a fintech writer and financial risk analyst based out of Paris. The Fed‚Äôs interest rate spikes are spooking the market, and speculative assets like bitcoin are amongst the hardest hit. Although once-touted as a non-correlative asset compared to equity markets, bitcoin‚Äôs beta is ultimately well past one as it falls at a rate nearly twice that of the struggling stock market. But, recently, it appears that the coin is stagnating below $20,000. In this apparent consolidation, some fear that it may simply be butting up against a previous support floor and that any additional bad bitcoin news will cause a further drop.‚Ä¶

entry.title: Free Talk Live Co-Host Ian Freeman Found Guilty in Federal Crypto Trial
entry.summary:
After close to two years, following the U.S. federal government accusing the Crypto Six of unlicensed money transmission, the case is seemingly coming to an end. According to multiple reports, Keene resident and libertarian activist, Ian Freeman, the last member of the Crypto Six case to be tried, was found guilty on all counts which included unlicensed money transmission, money laundering, and tax evasion. Freeman faces eight years in prison but he was not taken into custody on Thursday afternoon (ET). Reports detail that he must appear for sentencing on April 14, 2023, or appeal the verdict.
Ian Freeman Found Guilty of Unlicensed Money Transmission, Sentencing Hearing Scheduled for April 2023
During the first week of Dec. 2022, Bitcoin.com News reported on the Crypto Six case and how‚Ä¶

entry.title: CySEC Extends FTX EU‚Äôs CIF License Suspension to March 2023
entry.summary:
The Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission (CySEC) has extended the suspension of the Cyprus Investment Firm (CIF) license of the FTX (EU) Limited, the Cypriot subsidiary of bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange, FTX, to March 31, 2023.

The decision to continue with the license suspension was reached on Monday, December 19th, CySEC said in a statement released on Friday. The extension is to allow the subsidiary firm ‚Äúto proceed with the necessary actions in order to comply with the relevant provisions of the Investment Services and Activities and Regulated Markets Law of 2017,‚Äù CySEC explained.

The elongation comes over one month after the Cypriot financial markets regulator

entry.title: Bullish Indicator? Diamond Hands Dominate Shiba Inu Holder Base
entry.summary:
Shiba Inu is one of the cryptocurrencies in the market that is still receiving massive support despite the crypto winter. The meme coin is still extremely popular among investors and its holder base continues to grow. A new survey on Twitter has corroborated the support for Shiba Inu, showing that the vast majority of SHIB holders are in it for the long haul.
Diamond Hands Dominate Shiba Inu
In a poll posted by media outlet Cointelegraph on Twitter, the Shiba Inu community showed their commitment to the digital asset. The poll which asked which meme investments people were still holding onto included the likes of DOGE, AMC, GME, and of course, SHIB.¬†
By the time the poll was over, the overwhelming majority had voted in favor of SHIB. This saw it beat out its predecessor Dogecoin wh‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Final Word on Decentraland‚Äôs Numbers
entry.summary: Metaverse platforms present a challenge of sorting bots from real people, and then even real people can be inactive or AFK, short for ‚Äúaway from keyboard‚Äù for hours, days, even weeks. One way to filter out bots is to filter users by those with NFTs, which also weeds out ‚Äútourists‚Äù who pop in for a quick look and leave without meaningful interaction. In addition, it can be argued that those users with NFTs matter the most, as in a Web3 metaverse like Decentraland, users with NFTs such as ones that denote ownership of real estate in Decentraland (LAND) or wearable items that unlock some of the more popular experiences like ICE poker are the ones who are most active in the platform, and certainly are the most valuable to the ecosystem‚Äôs success.

entry.title: SEC Charges Against FTX, Alameda Execs Wang and Ellison Reveal Key Findings, US Regulator Says FTT Is a Security
entry.summary:
On Dec. 21, 2022, members of U.S. law enforcement detailed that FTX co-founder Gary Wang and ex-Alameda Research CEO Caroline Ellison have pleaded guilty to financial fraud charges. The recent charges against Wang and Ellison highlight some key findings and according to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), FTX‚Äôs exchange token FTT is considered a security.
SEC Complaint Says SBF ‚ÄòDirected‚Äô and ‚ÄòInstructed‚Äô High-up Execs Like Caroline Ellison to Commit Fraud
U.S. attorney Damian Williams told the public on Wednesday that charges have been filed against Caroline Ellison, the former CEO of Alameda Research, and Zixiao (Gary) Wang, the former Chief Technology Officer of FTX Trading Ltd. The Southern District of New York (SDNY) also told the press that Ellison and Wang were c‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX Founder Sam Bankman Fried Released On $250 Million Bail
entry.summary:
FTX founder and former CEO Sam Bankman Fried (SBF) had his first appearance in court following his extradition from the Bahamas. According to several reports, SBF was granted bail and will be able to live with his parents, the two U.S. Ivy League compliance lawyers, in Palo Alto, California.¬†
The former FTX CEO was presented in front of a Manhattan court. Here, a federal judge allowed his release where SBF met highly restrictive conditions, such as a $250 million bail and mandatory residency with his parents, Joseph Bankman and Barbara Fried, both law teachers at Stanford.¬†
FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Walks From Prison?
Until last night, SBF was in one of the world‚Äôs worst prisons. The FTX founder agreed to his extradition to the United States, where he will face two counts of ‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Court Grants Bail to Sam Bankman-Fried on Hefty $250M Bond
entry.summary:
The US Federal District Court in Manhattan on Thursday agreed to release on bail Sam Bankman-Fried, the Co-Founder and former CEO of bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange, FTX. US Magistrate Judge Gabriel Gorenstein granted the hefty release based on a hefty $250 million personal recognizance bond.

Nicolas Roos, Assistant US Attorney, describes the bond as ‚Äúthe largest ever pretrial bond,‚Äù Reuters reports. The bond was co-signed by Bankman-Fried‚Äôs parents, Barbara and Alan Bankman-Fried, who are both Standford Law professors, on their home in Palo Alto, California.

A relative and a non-relative are to fulfill the rest of the bond. This is even as Bankman-Fried has previously claimed he had just $100,000 in hi‚Ä¶

entry.title: Inaccurate U.S. Senate Testimony Misleads Lawmakers, Public About Bitcoin
entry.summary: In testimony before the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, actor Ben McKenzie and professor Hillary Allen offered inaccuracies about Bitcoin. This is an opinion editorial by Level39, a researcher focused on Bitcoin, technology, history, ethics and energy. On December 14, the U.S. Senate Committee on Banking, Housing & Urban Affairs received inaccurate testimony regarding Bitcoin from actor Ben McKenzie and Professor Hillary J. Allen. The hearing, entitled "Crypto Crash: Why the FTX Bubble Burst and Harm to Consumers," had all the markings of political theater and provided a stage to misinform senators and the public. It coincided with Elizabeth Warren's new financial surveillance bill, which is a disaster for privacy and civil liberties. On December 18, the Senate Banking Committee Chair Senat‚Ä¶

entry.title: Twitter Adds Crypto Price Charts to Search Results
entry.summary:
Twitter is now providing price charts with search results for major cryptocurrencies, such as bitcoin and ether. This new feature is ‚Äúone of many product improvements coming to financial Twitter,‚Äù said Elon Musk, owner of the social media platform.
Twitter Launches Price Chart Feature
Twitter announced in a series of tweets Wednesday that it is now providing price charts for major stocks, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), and cryptocurrencies.
‚ÄúWhen you tweet the symbol of a major stock, ETF, or crypto currency with a $ in front of it (like $BTC), people on Twitter see a clickable link that takes them to search results,‚Äù the official Twitter Business account explained, adding:
Starting today, these search results will include the pricing graphs for major symbols.

entry.summary: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Bored Ape Yacht Club Wins NFT Project of the Year
entry.summary: Illa Da Producer accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Yuga Labs from presenter Alanna Roazzi-Laforet at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Moonbirds, Azuki, DeGods, and CloneX.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Art Blocks Founder Wins Industry Achievement Award
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon accepted the industry achievement award from presenter Clara Tsao of Filecoin Foundation at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: BFF Wins Diversity Award
entry.summary: Rachel Weiss and Jackie Courtney accepted the Cryptie for BFF from presenter Rebecca Barkin of Lamina1 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were WomenRise, Boys Club, and The Hug.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year
entry.summary: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award
entry.summary: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year
entry.summary: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's business‚Äîplus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what he‚Äôs looking forward to in Web3.
